title: Cincinnati Bengals has jungle roaring
text:
Cincinnati Bengals has jungle roaring Bengals 5-0 3 things we learned about the Bengals 
CINCINNATI -- Despite trailing the Seattle Seahawks by 17 points in the fourth quarter on Sunday, the Cincinnati Bengals didn't flinch. "In our minds, as bad as it looked and as good as Seattle is, we never stopped playing" said tight end T... More 
Bob Bedinghaus, of the Cincinnati Bengals, remembers the dark days and the best days for this organization. 
"When the team wins, the city wins. That's what having major league sports is all about." Bedinghaus said. 
The city is roaring right along with him. Bengals gear is flying off the shelves at Koch's Sporting Goods and other retailers. 
"I bought Bengals slider shoes and an orange and black necklace," young Bengals shopper Mark Bionci said. 
"Fans are buying anything. It doesn't matter. When they're winning, people will come in for a hooded sweat shirt and they'll say while I'm here let me get some socks and let me get a hat." 
Eric Koch said a winning Bengals team is good for business. 
"Usually, we have a couple of customers that will come down from the hotels on the day after the games. But this has been non-stop," Koch said. 
Fans like Andrew Heckman, who drove in from South Bend, Indiana, for the weekend, are leaving behind cold hard cash. 
"Collectively we spent close to t$3,000 in three days. But it has been a great time," Heckman said. 
Ticket brokers like, Travis Jackson at Riverfront Choice Tickets, is also picking up on the big win. 
"We have been slammed since yesterday. The demand has been enormous, not only for the next game but for all the games," Jackson said. 
The Bengals next home come is a Thursday night AFC matchup against Cleveland.
